title: What should I master before becoming an air traffic controller? - Quora

response.answer_text: Creativity, short-term memory, and the ability to multi-task are important. It’s a job where you’re simultaneously working independently and as part of team… if that makes any sense. You’ll need to be able to remain calm and continue to perform efficiently under pressure, even when things go wrong. You will be responsible for respecting your own limits… you can very easily get yourself in a lot of trouble. Pilots and other controllers can get you in a lot of trouble too, if you let them. Controlling is not directly related to intelligence or any particular academic discipline. I’ve worked with brilliant controllers who I’m surprised were able to graduate from high school. Math, science… even any knowledge of aviation is not required. You’ll learn the bits you need to know on the job. Even today, it’s very difficult to determine who will be a good controller and who will not. The FAA has never had an effective screening program, although they have certainly tried. The only way to know for sure if a person is suited for it is through on-the-job training with live traffic. Bartenders, short-order cooks… those types of workers often transition very well into ATC. If you can be the cook in a busy Waffle House, you’ll probably make a good controller.
